review.title: Heuristic with elements of tabu search for Truck and Trailer Routing Problem
review.abstract: Vehicle Routing Problem is a well-known problem in logistics and transportation, and the variety of such problems is explained by the fact that it occurs in many real-life situations. It is an NP-hard combinatorial optimization problem and finding an exact optimal solution is practically impossible. In this work, Site-Dependent Truck and Trailer Routing Problem with hard and soft Time Windows and Split Deliveries is considered (SDTTRPTWSD). In this article, we develop a heuristic with the elements of Tabu Search for solving SDTTRPTWSD. The heuristic uses the concept of neighborhoods and visits infeasible solutions during the search. A greedy heuristic is applied to construct an initial solution.

sections.heading: 2 Heuristic algorithm
sections.text: The following parameters are used in the pseudo-code of the algorithm: n - the number of customers V - the amount of all customers K - the amount of all vehicles Ki - the number of vehicles available to the customer i Qk - the current remaining capacity of the vehicle K - the current remaining demand of the customer i vR - the number of soft time violations in route R - the current route S - the current solution S - the best solution found so far S - the number of allowed soft time violations w - the current number of remaining violations of the soft time window U - the number of all customers sorted the most expensive (furthest) customers first C - the cost of the current insertion corridor - the allowed level of violations CurrentState - the current state of the second heuristic proximity - the distance between customers to perform removals CV - the number of routes where the capacity of vehicles is violated.

sections.heading: 4 Conclusion
sections.text: In this paper, a new heuristics has been developed for the Site-Dependent Truck and Trailer Routing Problem with Time Windows and Split Deliveries. Heuristics takes a greedy approach to creating the initial solution and then uses elements of local search and taboo search to improve the initial solution. The results obtained are promising as they show improvements in most cases. The following work should be aimed at improving the speed of the algorithm and also guarantee the best possible results. One way to improve the algorithm is to use a new neighborhood - swap neighborhood where two customers can be exchanged from different routes, and there are other restrictions that can be relaxed, such as time windows and shared deliveries.
